page.title: 20Preparing for net-fishing
page.content: Fishing on the River Tweed near the village of Norham takes place at Pedwell fishery. The fishing rights are owned by Colonel Del Clermont. The season for net fishing is between February 14th and September 14th. Before the start of each season the nets are checked and mended and the boats repaired or replaced where necessary. A tractor and trailer are then employed to transport the boats or cobles from their winter home, down to Pedwell landing, which is shallow enough to permit the tractor to enter the water. Thanks to Norham School, Mr Cameron and members of Norham WI for compiling this text, and Mrs E.Craig Mrs.I.Grahamslaw and Mr C Moody for taking the slides of local views.
